intro: Antirrhinum polygaleifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf toadflax, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, two-lipped flowers that resemble the shape of a toad's mouth. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing a range of colors from yellow to orange. Antirrhinum polygaleifolium is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and floral display.
